title: BBC Local Live: East Yorkshire & northern Lincolnshire on Tuesday 29 August - BBC News
summary: visitors and residents celebrate freedom festival in hull .
former un secretary general kofi annan speaks to young .
road closures during hull 's freedom festival .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: we 're back on monday from 08:00 with more news from around the area .
before we go here 's five things we learned today :
have a wonderful weekend .
if you 're going to freedom festival have a great time
to see what 's on this evening and throughout the weekend click here .
this photo was taken this morning and i am sure there will be loads of amazing images coming out of this weekend 's cultural event .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's peter levy with tonight 's headlines on look north :
tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid - more at 1830
build a foot bridge , not difficult we have two in welton & melton , wow over the a63
all the events on the marina have out grown that area time to move events to other areas of hull city centre & parks in hull many thanks
move freedom to another area it will stop traffic issues !
it has out grown the marina now make it bigger & better for everyone
hi peter the traffic problems on castle street very bad move the freedom event off marina to other areas of hull town will stop the traffic
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: biologist 's drawings on display at hull 's deep
text: a series of images by german biologist , ernst haeckel will go on show at the deep from today .
this is the first time haeckel 's work has been showcased in a public gallery in the uk since his death in 1919 .
hundreds of his images were put together to create 10 volumes .
many of the organisms included within these collections were first described and classified by haeckel himself .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather forecast : evening showers will fade away
text: evening showers will die away after dusk , with clear spells expected overnight .
it will become cool towards dawn
on saturday it will be a dry and cool start with mist patches clearing .
often dry and sunny .
a few light afternoon showers are possible .
on sunday it will start off sunny but cloud will increase with some light rain later .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bridlington 's hospital services 'not under threat '
text: the york teaching hospitals trust says there 's no threat to services at bridlington hospital because of its financial situation .
the trust runs bridlington hospital and it revealed earlier this week that it will run out of cash soon and is organising loans to tide it over .
it says its financial problems are partly due to the rising cost of hiring agency and locum staff .
it says it 's working on a financial recovery plan .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: heavy congestion around hull city centre
text: there is still heavy congestion on a number of roads around hull city centre .
there are reports of an overturned lorry on bank side causing problems to traffic flow .
the bbc 's carl wheatley has told us that it 's taken him nearly an hour to get from the bbc offices in hull to hull royal infirmary , a journey which take 10 minutes on a normal day .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: freedom festival : haircuts by children , do you dare to go in ?
text: as part of the freedom festival a shop has been opened up in the city centre , where festival goers can get their haircut by children .
hulll 2017 chairman rosie millard is one of the lucky customers to take a seat .
this was the end result .
do n't worry rosie it looks like the heads behind you had a difficult experience .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: walton street car park shut from today
text: the gates on walton street car park in hull are to be locked from today - unless there 's a market , football match or another event on at the kcom stadium .
hull city council say it 's to stop unauthorised access and improve security at around the football ground .
if you leave you car there it will be locked in and you could get a £ 75 fine .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus company 'doing best ' to keep services going in hull
text: east midlands stage coach have sent this tweet saying that they 're doing the best to keep services running .
# hull no let up in the gridlock in the city centre , we are doing are very best to keep things running but its out of our control !
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: spoil heap to be removed in grimsby
text: developers of a site on humberston avenue in grimsby have promised to remove a spoil heap , after complaints from people living locally .
initially steps were taken to cover the spoil heap , but it has now been decided to remove it after people living nearby said it ruined the outlook for certain properties .
local mp martin vickers says he 's pleased the developers have listened to the concerns of people .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: appeal to find owners of sunken boats
text: appeal to find owners of sunken boats

documents.title: travel news : big traffic queues around hull city centre
text: there are reports of heavy traffic around hull city centre causing delays to journeys .
the hull explorer says its tour bus is experiencing delays of 35 minutes at all stops due to heavy traffic .
bus company eyms says traffic is a nightmare .
they are reporting big queues of traffic around the city centre .
p & o have tweeted that ferry passengers should allow more time because of this weekend 's freedom festival .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: new later bus service for cherry burton and etton residents
text: a bus company is to launch a new service to help two villages near beverley following a request from residents .

villagers in cherry burton appealed to councils and bus operators to provide a later service back from beverley on weekdays , as the last bus currently leaves from the town at 15.35 during school term times , and 15.00 during school holidays .
as a result , acklams coaches , which is based in beverley , has agreed to divert one of its existing buses to provide a later journey to cherry burton and etton from beverley .
the new service will begin monday 4 september and will run from monday to friday , departing from beverley sow hill bus station at 17:10 during school term times .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: drinking water fountains to open in hull
text: three new drinking fountains are opening in hull city centre today .
they 've been installed by yorkshire water and are designed to take people on a route from king edward square to the marina via queen 's gardens .
it 's hoped that it will encourage people to drink more water .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cod wars weapon presented to hull maritime museum
text: an underwater device used by icelandic fishermen to sabotage british trawlers during the cod wars has been presented to hull maritime museum .

warp cutters were developed by the icelandic coastguard to cut the nets of foreign vessels during a bitter conflict with the uk , which started when iceland imposed a limit on how much fish could be caught in its waters in the 1970s .
it was presented to the museum as part of a visit by civic leaders from reykjavik .
in return , a `` souvenir of friendship '' was presented to icelandic retired coastguard gylfi giersson , hull city council said .
reykjavik and hull are sister cities , and for a good reason both are great cultural cities , and it is our hope and certainty that the common bond that unites us will continue to be strong ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: les girafes to parade through hull this evening
text: people in hull this evening can expect a carnival atmosphere as compagnie off present les girafes .
the event begins at 20.00 and starts in king edward square .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: help wanted to find owners of sunken boats
text: people living in east yorkshire are being asked to help find the owners of 10 sunken boats in the river hull between tickton and beverley beck .
east riding of yorkshire council plans to remove the vessels later this month .
the boats will be re-floated and lifted from the river .
it 's hoped that clearing the river will help improve the flow and reduce the risk of flooding .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: grimsby 's ice arena changes hands
text: grimsby 's ice arena is being handed over today , to the people who use it .
north east lincolnshire council had wanted to close the town 's rink because it was too expensive for them to run .
but the grimsby ice rink community group campaigned to keep it open .
the plans which were approved by the council last month will secure the ice-rink 's future in the town .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your headlines this lunch time
text: your headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire this morning :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cod wars weapon presented to museum
text: cod wars weapon presented to museum

documents.title: kofi 's top 10 for freedom festival
text: with over 200 events planned for this weekend 's freedom festival it can be overwhelming trying to decide what to see .
here 's my top 10 choices for the weekend :
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: grimsby film highlighting addiction to go nationwide
text: the stories of people from north east lincolnshire who have come through drug and alcohol addictions are going to be shared with others across the uk .
a film submitted by the foundations service , which is based in grimsby , has been short-listed for a national award .
it tells the story of some of their peer mentors , who have come through addictions themselves and now work to help others .
it will now be shown to similar organisations around the country .
this is the first time we have ever done anything like this .
the first time we came across it we thought it was a really good idea to get some people to talk about the steps in their recovery ''
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: former un general secretary speaks to young people in hull
text: former general secretary kofi annan is speaking to young people in hull as part of the freedom festival .
he will also deliver the keynote speech in hull tomorrow morning .
the hull youth enterprise have sent this tweet letting people who have tickets know that it 's taking place at 11.30 not 15.30 as originally being advertised .
urgent time change the kofi annan lecture @ twitterid tomorrow will now take place at 11.30am - not 3.30pm as advertised please rt
author: Crispin Rolfe
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: 2017 's rosie millard is excited about seeing kofi annan
text: hull 2017 's chairman rosie millard has tweeted her excitement as she prepares to meet former un general secretary kofi annan .
kofi annan will deliver a keynote speech to the freedom festival this weekend .
now getting best clothes on .
for lunch .
with .
kofi .
annan .
@ twitterid
is he in hull ?
i ca n't see him in the programme # freedomfestival # vip
he 's giving the wilberforce lecture tomorrow at city hall , 11.30 am
now you are just showing off .
enjoy your lunch .
sounds like a wonderful start to september , here 's to doing lunch too one day rosie x
he 'll be saying the same about you .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: what can we expect from freedom festival ?
text: the organisers of this year 's freedom festival say they want a european feel to the city and have promised to , `` keep the party going longer . ''
the new festival tent in queens gardens will be transformed into a festival party for one and all after 10pm on both friday and saturday night .
the beats bus is a mobile recording studio .
music workshops will be run by local hip hop favourites giving young people of the city a chance to express themselves
amortal combat is a dance-theatre , music , humour street show dealing with duels , duos , love and hatred in 25 minutes .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: guy martin to make new world record attempt
text: grimsby racing legend guy martin could break another world record in our area this weekend .
the tt star first broke the world record for speed on a wall of death in march last year , clocking 78 mph .
the wall of death will make an appearance at a kirmington pub this weekend , with guy tipped to make another world record bid .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: disruption expected on northern rail services
text: train passengers are facing disruption this morning as northern rail workers go on strike .
members of the rmt union are taking part in industrial action over plans to cut the number of guards on trains .
they are also planning on walking out on monday .
northern runs services across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
we are trying very hard with the rmt trade union to find a solution to this and we ask that they work along side us to explore how we might staff trains and stations in the future .
we would welcome them to come back around the table and have serious talks about our modernisation programme .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull 's freedom festival gets under way
text: the freedom festival gets under way in hull today with more than 100,000 people expected to attend over the course of the weekend .
this year is the 10th anniversary of the festival and features a keynote speech by former united nations secretary general kofi annan , above arriving at humberside airport yesterday .
it will also see music , comedy and other cultural activities take place throughout the city centre over the next three days .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: weather : cool but bright start to the day
text: it 's a cool but bright start to the day with any fog or mist patches soon clearing .
here 's my full weather forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to today 's live feed across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire on friday 1 september .
i 'm jonathan and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
just to remind everyone there is a strike on northern trains today .
do n't get caught out like i did .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull city of culture to spoof itself
text: hull city of culture to spoof itself
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: we 're back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news from around the area .
before we go here 's five things we learned today :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull 's cruise terminal plans 'progressing '
text: plans for a new cruise terminal for hull are progressing , according to the leader of hull city council .
the preferred location for the £ 17m terminal is near the deep at sammy point .
stephen brady says he 's confident hull will get a cruise terminal :
we 're talking to the government now .
they 're very warm towards the idea , to have the cruise terminal in hull ''

documents.title: our headlines on look north tonight
text: here are the headlines from bbc look north tonight .
tune in from 18.30 on bbc one .
tonight 's headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather forecast this evening
text: this evening cloud will build with the possibility of scattered slow-moving showers developing .
any showers will soon die out with a fine and chilly night to follow as skies clear .
winds will remain light .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: images of scunthorpe people smuggler released
text: the home office has released images of a man from scunthorpe who was sentenced to three and a half years in jail for people smuggling .
huzaifi hasan musa , 22 , of mary street , scunthorpe , was caught after the van he was driving was stopped by border force officers in france .
five iraqi nationals , including one child , were found hidden in cabinets .
uk border force says people like musa put vulnerable lives at risk .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after a166 smash
text: a man 's been airlifted to hospital following an accident on the a166 garrowby hill near pocklington .
police were called to the incident involving two cars - a white ford kuga and a black porsche near bugthorpe at around 13:30 bst this afternoon .
two men were taken to hospital in york and another was taken via air ambulance to leeds general infirmary following the accident .
road closures are currently in place and motorists are advised to avoid the area .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: scunthorpe man jailed for people smuggling attempt
text: a man from scunthorpe has been jailed for three and a half years after he attempted to smuggle a child and four people into the uk hidden in cabinets .
huzaifi hasan musa , 22 , of mary street , scunthorpe , was caught after the van he was driving was stopped by border force officers in france .
a woman and child were found in one cabinet and three men in another .
all five were iraqi nationals .

musa claimed that he had been to visit his step-grandmother near dunkirk though he could n't provide an address to officers and said that he had taken her furniture because he had intended to throw it all away .
people smugglers like musa exploit the vulnerable and put lives at risk ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: road closures announced for hull 's freedom festival
text: a number of roads will be closed in and around hull city centre this afternoon for this weekend 's freedom festival .
festival organisers say the closures will allow people to walk around the site .
the roads will be re-opened on monday .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic news : a166 closed in both directions
text: the a166 is closed both ways because of an accident between barf lane and garrowby road .
the yorkshire air ambulance is also in attendance .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: hull fc face leeds following challenge cup win
text: hull fc face leeds rhinos in the super 8s this evening , five days after their challenge cup victory .
hull fc , who beat the rhinos in the semi-finals of the challenge cup , rest liam watts , mark minichiello and josh griffin after saturday 's wembley win over wigan .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: actress honours safety fighter big lil
text: actress honours safety fighter big lil

documents.title: man wanted over assault in bridlington
text: humberside police are looking for help in identifying a man they want to speak to in connection with an assault in bridlington .
the incident is said to have happened around 01:30 on thursday 24 august .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : transfer deadline day - what 's going on ?
text: it 's the last day for football clubs to sign and sell players before the transfer window closes at midnight tonight .
here 's a summary from matt dean about what we can expect :
who 's doing what on # transferdeadlineday ?
@ mattdeanradio has more :
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: your headlines this lunch time
text: here 's the latest headlines for east yorkshire and the humber this morning :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: ukranian folk opera kick-starts freedom festival
text: an interactive musical theatre production highlighting the crisis in ukraine has kick-started the freedom festival in hull .
the festival is marking its 10th anniversary this weekend with hundreds of live music , theatre , poetry and street art performances set to take place across the city centre and on the marina .
ukrainian production counting sheep : a guerrilla folk opera , which started on wednesday , and a lecture by former united nations secretary-general kofi annan are among the highlights .
others include a procession of giant giraffe statues in queen victoria square by french theatre company compagnie off and a mass participatory dance show involving up to a 100 volunteers .
organiser mikey martins says he wants to create a continental feel to the festival .
i love those european festivals where you 're sitting there on the street at 10 o'clock or 11 o'clock at night and you see loads of kids and older people hanging out .
i really want us to create that atmosphere in hull ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: maxine peake 's play tickets about campaigner lillian bilocca going on sale
text: tickets for a play written by maxine peake about safety campaigner lillian bilocca go on sale at 2pm this afternoon .
this site-specific performance will lead audiences through hull 's historic guildhall , the grade ii listed home of hull city council .
it follows lilly in 1968 as she and her friends dare to speak out and take action to improve the safety conditions for their men at sea .

we hope our telling of this story about the extraordinary women from this extraordinary city will entertain and stimulate an outsider 's view on a past community in a city that is very much alive and kicking hard ! ''
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: big events revealed for hull 's city of culture season four
text: hull 2017 's chief executive martin green has taken to the stage to announce what people can expect over the next four months .
here are some of the things we can expect over the next four months .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: maxine peake talks about work of hull campaigner lillian bilocca
text: writer and actress maxine peake tells the audience about her plans to showcase the work of hull campaigner lillian bilocca who fought for safer working conditions on the trawler fleets .
she said lillian bilocca was an amazing woman and a `` fantastic presence . ''
tickets for the work showcasing the campaign by lillian bilocca go on sale from 14:00 bst today .

documents.title: city of culture plans to 'go beyond 2017 '
text: the man in charge of delivering hull 's city of culture events has told an audience the next four months will celebrate successful contemporary artists .
martin green , the chief executive of hull 2017 , was speaking at the launch of hull 's season four called `` tell the world . ''
he told people that they have plans for city which go beyond 2017 and will carry on for the next few years .
you can watch the announcement live here .
tell the world will 'propel us into the years ahead '
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: maxine peake talks about lillian bilocca play
text: actress maxine peake has been talking to bbc radio humberside 's david burns about the play she has written on the life of hull safety campaigner lillian bilocca .
maxine was speaking during an announcement on what people can expect from season four of city of culture .
you can watch the announcement live here .
i was just fascinated about these women who led ordinary lives but did extraordinary things .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: council leader : hull 2017 has 'exceeded all our expectations '
text: hull city of council leader stephen brady has announced that hull 's year as city of culture has exceeded all their expectations
he was speaking at the launch ofhull 's city of culture season four called , `` tell the world . ''
mr brady also told people watching that hull has the fastest growing economy in yorkshire and 500 jobs have been created in the city centre since the start of 2017 .
you can watch the announcement live here .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: new maxine peake play to premiere in hull
text: a new play written by actress maxine peake is to honour a woman who battled to improve safety on north sea trawlers .
hull 's lillian bilocca , known as big lil , led a campaign after three ships sank in 1968 with the loss of 58 lives .
the hull truck theatre show in november will be part of the final season of events being announced for hull 's year as city of culture .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: live : city of culture season four announcement
text: an announcement is being made on what people can expect over the next four months from hull 's city of culture events .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: concerns over teenagers using gas in pocklington
text: it 's too easy for young people to order so-called laughing gas online , according to politicians in pocklington .
they 've expressed concern after empty nitrous oxide gas canisters were found littering the town 's skateboard park .
they 've advised parents to make sure their children are not getting gas canisters delivered in the post .
a court ruled yesterday that the sale of nitrous oxide is legal , because of a loophole in the drugs laws .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: deadline for litter enforcement in hull approaches
text: people in hull have until today to decide whether or not they 'd support litter enforcement in the city .
it could include on-the-spot fines for those caught dropping rubbish .
hull city council says all options will be explored if the public supports the idea .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: beverley 's kyle edmund through to third round of us open
text: beverley 's kyle edmund is through to the third round of the us open .
edmund , ranked 42nd , beat american steve johnson 7-5 6-2 7-6 ( 7-4 ) to reach round three for the second year running .
he will next face unseeded 18-year-old canadian denis shapovalov , who upset french eighth seed jo-wilfried tsonga 6-4 6-4 7-6 ( 7-3 ) .
he is the last briton standing after six were initially entered in the main draw .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: hull 's final city of culture season announced
text: the fourth and final season of hull 's city of culture year has just been announced .
the final season is called `` tell the world '' and organisers say it 's about spreading the message about hull and securing a lasting legacy for the city .
the last four months will see the reopening of the hull new theatre and the turner prize come to the ferens art gallery .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: weather forecast : a dry start to the morning
text: a bright start to the morning in most places , with some cloud developing this afternoon .
here 's my full weather forecast
author: Owain Wyn Evans
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to today 's live feed across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire on thursday 31 august .
i 'm jonathan and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: we 're back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news from around the area .
before we go here 's five things we learned today :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid at 1830 on bbc one .
surely old headlines already broadcast today and possibly yesterday ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: north east lincolnshire council to introduce fortnightly bin collections
text: north east lincolnshire council has voted in favour of introducing fortnightly bin collections .
it 's believed the changes will save the council around four hundred thousand pounds .
people against the plans have said they 're furious , with some saying they 've lost confidence in the council .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: this evening 's weather : showers will tend to fade away
text: showers will tend to fade away this evening , though a few may persist near the coast .
it will turn quite chilly in rural spots where some mist patches are likely to form .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plans for go-ape given approval in north lincolnshire
text: plans for a new go ape activity centre in north lincolnshire have been given the go ahead .
go ape will be built at normanby hall .
the tree top adventure course , with zip wires and rope swings , could create around 30 jobs at normanby hall country park next year .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : police taking steps to improve morale
text: humberside police says it 's taking steps to improve morale amongst its staff after a survey revealed three quarters of those questioned said they did not feel valued at work .
deputy chief constable andy mcdyer is from humberside police :
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull fc coach has n't had time to enjoy challenge cup win
text: hull fc coach lee radford says tomorrow 's super 8s game at leeds does n't allow them to fully celebrate their challenge cup success .
the short turnaround between such high-profile games is for the benefit of tv .
it 's meant he 's not been able to spend much time savouring the wembley success and he thinks it would have been a better game if played at the weekend .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: thief steals three charity boxes from bakery
text: a thief has broken into a bakery and stolen three charity boxes .
the incident happened at half past midnight on monday at kirton lindsey .
the thief is about 5ft 6ins tall and was wearing a black jacket and winter-style hat .
he is thought to have smashed the shop window before stealing three charity boxes from the counter .
police are appealing for any witnesses .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: industrial action on northern railway services this week
text: northern railway has sent out a tweet reminding people who use the service that between friday 1 and monday 4 september there is planned industrial action .
the strike is over dispute between the rail company and trade unions about the role of guards on trains .
a 24-hour strike was held during the first day of the tour de yorkshire earlier this year .
northern rail say they expect to run a significantly reduced service .
industrial action planned on 1 & 4 september will affect our services .
please check before you travel
brilliant !
absolute jokers !
and a whole week 's notice !
thanks for that !
too late to change rotas etc , another 3 hour journey home cos i work beyond 5pm .
ridiculous
hi jo , the industrial action was announced on friday 18 : ^lm
even that is too late & time tables are n't out yet !
will still be a long ass day for me , again .
we can only announce a strike when the union announce it jo , we wish we knew of them more in advance ^vr
you ( northern ) have no idea the chaos , stress & upheaval you 're causing on a regular basis to daily commuters .
strikes are n't working !
the strikes , are not arranged by northern , they are arranged by the union .
we are aware of the chaos they bring .
^vr
any disruption on manchester picc to blackpool north on friday ?
i ca n't find anything on the website
we are in the process of adding our revised timetables to the site , please check back with us tomorrow .
^lm
what time are they being updated ?
i could do with making alternative plans if it is that there is no train
the timetables will be posted on our feed as soon as they are ready , please keep an eye on our feed for them ^db
is this train still running at this time ?
there is nothing on the website about the man-blakpool train service still showing up on trainline
hi steve , you can check on services here : ^lm
will the preston - bolton replacement buses still be running on these days ?
the strike timetables are yet to be confirmed , please keep an eye on our feed as they will be published here when they are ready ^db
so there might not be buses ?
on top of no trains for 3 weeks ?
we will be able to confirm the services once the timetables are live ^vr
well some sort of transport for all the money i 've already paid you would be nice .
the timetables will be available next week ^vr
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: ministry of justice says hmp humber 'is improving '
text: action 's been taken to tackle drugs problems at an east yorkshire prison , according to the ministry of justice .
the response comes after an inspection of the category 'c ' hmp humber found high levels of violence , staff shortages and problems with drugs and rats .
a new governor has been appointed since the inspection .
the prison has put in place a new action plan to tackle the supply and use of drugs in the prison , and has already begun work to boost the number of prison officers ''
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: protests outside north east lincolnshire council over refuse collections
text: people have started protesting outside the north east lincolnshire council offices in grimsby over planned cuts to bin and library services .
the council wants to replace the weekly service with fortnightly refuse collections , to try and save more than £ 400,000 .
a decision on the future of collection services will be made later today .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: force says 'spit guard ' hood used just once during trial period
text: humberside police has revealed officers have only used a controversial spit guard once during a three-month pilot .
the netted hoods are placed over a person 's head if they attempt to bite or spit at an officer or member of the public during incidents .
at the time humberside police said they are designed to keep people safe and the police federation said they were essential in protecting officers .
critics say spit hoods are distressing and humiliating , can cause panic in the detained person and make it harder to notice if a prisoner is having difficulty breathing .

documents.title: millionth visitor to hull 's museums has this message
text: hull city council have tweeted this message from amy , who is the one millionth to visit hull 's museums .
here 's amy from hull who is our one millionth visitor to @ twitterid she says everyone should visit !
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: hull city signs wolves striker nouha dicko
text: hull city have signed striker nouha dicko from championship club wolves for an undisclosed fee .
the 25-year-old mali international has signed a three-year deal .
dicko scored 35 goals in 108 appearances for wolves during a loan spell and following his subsequent permanent move in january 2014 .
i found out that hull were interested in signing me and things started moving from there .
i 'm glad that everything is sorted now and i 'm looking forward to settling down here and getting started . ''
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: hull 's museums reach million-visitor target
text: the number of people visiting hull 's museums and galleries has reached one million .
the city council says it was hoping to reach that target by the end of the city of culture year , but it 's been reached four months early .
those involved says it 's great news for the city and shows how city of culture is attracting more people to visit .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire this morning :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull city sign jackson irvine from burton albion
text: hull city has confirmed they have signed australian international jackson irvine from burton albion for an undisclosed fee .
speaking via twitter jackson had this message for tigers fans .
| welcome , @ twitterid are delighted to confirm the signing of jackson irvine from @ twitterid # welcomejackson
| read the full story as @ twitterid pens a three-year deal at the kcom stadium # welcomejackson
| @ twitterid is excited to be playing for your club , @ twitterid fans !
# welcomejackson
| watch @ twitterid first interview as a @ twitterid player on # tigerstv # welcomejackson
| i 'm absolutely delighted to be signing here . ''
@ jirvine36 discusses his move to @ twitterid # welcomejackson
yeh the big name we have all been waiting for who is he again ? ? ?
get him to a good hairdresser before anything else .
mark hill is very good and will soon have him looking something like .
what number will he take ?
welcome , hoping to see big things from you !
all the best pal .
hull city !
good man
excited to see you here jackon .
all the best with hull city afc
which one is she
i 'm behind his head , he 's obviously seen me
he looks well happy !
love him !
genuinely the most enthusiastic out of all the players we 've signed so far can only be good .
author: Matt Dean
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: culture city museums top million visits
text: culture city museums top million visits

documents.title: call for more 'therapy dogs ' across our area
text: there 's a call for dog owners to come forward to allow their pets to act as therapy animals in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
therapy dogs nationwide send dogs into places such as care homes , where they help comfort people .
now they need new volunteers in our area as they say there is a large waiting list of venues wanting to make use of the dogs .
in places like residential homes , therapy dogs help people engage in talking .
it can calm people down .
some people with severe dementia respond better to the dogs rather than humans ''
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: survey reveals low morale at humberside police
text: a survey released today reveals that morale remains low among staff at humberside police
the police federation , which carried out the research , surveyed more than a quarter of the people currently employed by the force .
the federation said that 59 % of those who responded believed decisions which affected them had not been made in a fair way and over a third said they were n't being treated fairly .
three quarters of those surveyed said they did not feel valued at work and their workload was too high .
humberside police said since the new chief constable 's arrival in may more time has been spent listening to the concerns of front line officers .
the force is also working to create a better shift pattern .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: protests over bin collection plans in north east lincolnshire
text: there 'll be protests today as north east lincolnshire council decides whether to change how often bins are collected and how long libraries are open for .
the council wants to replace the current weekly refuse collection service with fortnightly collections in a bid to save more than £ 400,000 a year .
today 's cabinet meeting will also look at plans to reduce library opening hours .
a protest against the plans will take place outside the meeting .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: east yorkshire prison has problem with drugs
text: a report into an east yorkshire prison has found it has problems with drugs , staff shortages , assaults and rats .
the inspection from the independent monitoring board took place last year at hmp humber .
it found staff and prisoners felt insecure , with five deaths in custody during that period and low morale among staff .
inspectors also discovered that illegal substances and mobile phones were still getting into the prison , sometimes using drones .
a new prison governor has been appointed since the inspection took place .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: henry viii blockhouse to be excavated
text: henry viii blockhouse to be excavated

documents.title: weather : a dry morning with rain expected later
text: it will be a dry start to the morning , with showers expected later in the afternoon .
here 's my full forecast
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , jonathan here with all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: we 're back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news from around the area .
join us then .
before we go here 's five things we learned today :
here 's one of the latest murals to go up in hull 's marina .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's peter levy with tonight 's headlines :
tonight 's news headlines with @ twitterid - more on bbc one at 1830 .
army veteran should get in touch with veterans association uk ( vauk ) they will give her all the help she needs
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: north lincolnshire getting ready for tour of britain
text: north lincolnshire council has tweeted there is one week to go until they host this year 's tour of britain .
around 120 of the world 's top cyclists will take on a 172km stage , starting from normanby hall country park and finishing in the centre of scunthorpe near central park .

north lincolnshire is a brilliant place and now people across the country will be able to discover all the great things it has to offer when they visit to watch stage three racing through north lincolnshire ''
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: rspca says cat-in-bin 'horrendous '
text: animal welfare charity the rspca has called the actions of a 12-year-old girl putting , then leaving a cat in a bin as horrendous .
they also confirmed that it 's not clear what happened to the cat .
it was no longer in the bin when the resident with cctv cameras checked the footage and realised what had happened .
it 's horrendous .
it 's just something we should not be experiencing in this day in age .
it 's not appropriate behaviour at all .
i do n't know what the girl was expecting by putting the cat in the bin . ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ferens art gallery will close to host turner prize
text: hull city council has tweeted the ferens art gallery will close between the 5-11 september to prepare for hosting the turner prize .
lubaina himid , who 's artwork is above , is one of the four artists shortlisted for this year 's prize .
it is the first time in two decades that artists over the age of 50 can be considered for the award .
their work will go on display from 26 september - 7 january .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: calls for more foster parents across east yorkshire
text: the east riding of yorkshire council is looking to recruit new foster carers for young children .
the council wants foster carers for children of all ages , including sibling groups .
there is also a need for people who are willing to be a short break foster carer for a child with a disability .
two events are being held in september for those who might be interested and want more information .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: mother takes child to police over cat-in-bin cctv
text: a mother has taken her young daughter to a police station after cctv images of a girl dropping a black cat into a rubbish bin in bransholme , hull , emerged on social media .
the footage was filmed on 17 august and shows the girl looking inside the bin before dropping the cat inside .
she then places a bag of rubbish on top of the bin .
since the footage appeared on social media the mother of a 12 year-old girl has been to a police station with the girl to say her daughter was the person in the video .
humberside police say they will talk with the girl about the incident and decide on the best course of action .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather forecast : remaining largely cloudy
text: this evening it will be dry at first , with some evening bright spells , especially across yorkshire .
overnight the cloud will thicken , bringing a chance of further outbreaks of rain , especially for the humber .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hull museums to welcome millionth visitor
text: hull 's museums will welcome their one millionth visitor of 2017 on wednesday .
the busiest day on record was 21 january , which coincided with the opening of the francis bacon and open exhibition at the ferens art gallery .
over 12,000 visits were recorded .
the ferens art gallery also attracted over 175,000 visits during the skin exhibition , which featured spencer tunick 's sea of hull .
we are delighted that such large numbers of people have visited our museums and art gallery during our year as uk city of culture .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: people in hull to give views on litter enforcement
text: people in hull have until thursday to decide whether or not they 'd support litter enforcement in the area .
hull city council says this may include on-the-spot fines for those caught dropping litter .
people who live in the city can vote via an online link on the council 's website .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: grimsby town supporters ' anger over stevenage fc response
text: grimsby town supporter 's group , the mariners trust , has published a tweet that stevenage fc wo n't speak directly to them after they raised concerns about some of the security checks carried out towards female supporters .
marinerstrust
marinerstrust
we 've been informed by stevenage fc they wo n't be replying to us directly about any of our complaints # gtfc marinerstrust.co.uk/stevenage-upda
the mariners trust made the allegations about the treatment of some female fans after the two sides met on saturday 19 august .
at the time stevenage fc said it implemented `` a full , 100 % compliant , searching regime '' after fears of `` the potential for anti-social and un-cooperative behaviour '' .
they have instead contacted officials at grimsby town and asked them to keep the response confidential - and away from the supporters who complained ''
we 've been informed by stevenage fc they wo n't be replying to us directly about any of our complaints # gtfc
ffs do n't you think there 's more things to worry about in this sad mad world ?
let it go and move on and concentrate on the football
aw didums does this show your club in a bad light ?
wait until it happens to you and your wife and kids then u might see why people are angry
never going to happen to my wife or children cos im not stupid enough to let it happen for the sake of a football match so stop ur crying
so possible sexual assaults are n't important ?
'possible ' or 'alleged ' ?
the devil 's in the detail my fishy friends
both .
oh dear , this one 's going nowhere fast .
possible that some elements of the complaints gave led to police investigation ?
if so then probably right to keep quiet for now
we are not aware this is the case .
so @ twitterid have asked @ twitterid to keep their response confidential .
will # gtfc be doing so ?
it 's been raised at board level .
give us/the club some time on this one
nothing to do with which club you support.frankly amazed that some people are complaining about us whining or that it does n't matter .
to be honest we 're astonished at some of the comments we 've had from stevenage fans .
ca n't believe # gtfc fans would behave in same way .
it comes down to the north south divide it 's absolutely disgusting it boils down to .
northern neanderthals get what they deserve
well i 'm a southerner masquerading as a northerner so to them .
have you considered civil action ?
they would have to respond to that .
also how are @ twitterid responding to you ?
believe some supporters maybe considering legal action .
gtfc very supportive of us .
that is a disgrace - how can a football club do this .
i wonder if there is a potential litigation either with steward , or police that 's why
we 're not aware this is the reason why they wo n't communicate with us directly .
maybe you 'd have seen a response if you could be trusted not to use it in another publicity stunt .
maybe a lesson for you to learn there .
let 's see what the efl says , eh ?
author: Phillip Norton
BBC News

documents.title: east yorkshire drag racing track 'facing closure '
text: a drag racing track in east yorkshire could close down unless the operators can raise £ 100,000 .
york raceway at the former seaton ross airfield needs the money to resurface the runway and provide new buildings .
the drag racing venue has operated for the past 40 years and it 's one of just three drag racing tracks in the country .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: camper van parked in way of rescue boat operation
text: the police say the owner of a camper van parked outside hornsea 's inshore rescue boat compound at the weekend could face sanctions from the east riding council
the police say the van could have delayed the deployment of the hornsea rescue boat in an emergency as the boat crew may have been unable to park their cars .
it 's just two weeks since the east riding council appealed for blue badge owners to park considerately and announced a clampdown on abuses of the blue badge system .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: could go-ape be coming to north lincolnshire ?
text: plans for go ape a new visitor attraction for north lincolnshire , will be examined by the local council this week .
the tree top adventure course , with zip wires and rope swings , could create around 30 jobs at normanby hall country park next year .
there are already 30 similar high rope adventure sites around the country , with the nearest currently at sherwood forest in nottinghamshire .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: woman , 77 , in critical condition after crash near goole
text: a 77 year old woman 's in a critical condition in hospital after a car collided with a tree in pollington near goole on sunday afternoon .
the woman , who was a passenger in the car is being treated in hospital in leeds .
the 80 year old male driver of the car has serious but not life threatening injuries .
police are appealing for witnesses to come forward .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : hull fc celebrate challenge cup win
text: monday saw thousands of hull fc fans come out to celebrate their team winning the challenge cup final against wigan .
in case you missed the celebrations here are the highlights of what happened .
author: Simon Clark
BBC Look North

documents.title: millions lost to fixed-odds betting
text: research out today shows that since 2008 people across east yorkshire and lincolnshire have lost £ 250m to fixed-odds betting terminals
at the moment you can bet up to £ 100 per spin but the campaign for fairer gambling want this brought down to £ 2 .
but ursula servis who 's from the association for british bookmakers says it would n't make a difference .
there is no evidence to support a reduction in the stake and all you would do is push problem gamblers elsewhere ''
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic news : a165 near bridlington blocked
text: humberside police have sent this tweet following a traffic accident on the a165 near bridlington
the road is currently closed in both directions while a recovery team remove the lorry .
a165 currently closed due to rtc and recovery of vehicles .
traffic backed up into bridlington and you may experience delays .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: man , 79 , dies in hull after being hit by taxi
text: a man 's died after being hit by a taxi in hull on sunday evening .
the 79-year-old man who was involved in the accident on ferensway died of his injuries in hospital yesterday .
police are asking for anyone who saw the incident to get in touch with them on the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire this morning :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: children encouraged to take part in opera
text: young children and their parents are going to be encouraged to take part in workshops inspired by opera when they visit the deep in hull this week .
it 's a collaboration between the aquarium and opera north to develop the relationship between parents and children and is based around songs influenced by the sea life on show .
the workshops begin today and will also be running on thursday and friday .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: beverley 's kyle edmund progresses in us open
text: beverley 's kyle edmund has progressed into the second round of the us open .
edmund , who reached the fourth round in new york last year , impressively defeated dutch 32nd seed robin haase 6-3 7-5 6-3 in under two hours .
world number 42 edmund is the highest-ranked british male player in the tournament after the withdrawal of andy murray .
the 22-year-old arrived at flushing meadows after a semi-final appearance at last week 's winston-salem open , meaning his victory over haase was his eighth match in nine days .
was very tired this morning .
i have played a lot of matches .
my coach said today is not about tactics , it 's about mentality .
i had to drink a can of cola to get my sugar up , but then i started to get into the match .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: east marsh estate is 'going to win '
text: a local councillor has told people living on the east marsh estate in grimsby that they can beat the anti-social behaviour affecting the area .
events have been held recently , like the local fete above , to help show the positive aspects of life on the estate .
there 's a meeting for local people tonight , where problems which have plagued the area , including drug-dealing and anti-social behaviour , will be discussed .
councillor steve beasant believes they will turn things around .
i am telling residents we are going to win .
we are half way down this journey and we are going to win .
we 've had enough of the negativity and we are going to make sure we turn the estate around
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull fc to turn attention to super league after challenge cup win
text: after lifting the challenge cup this weekend , hull fc 's coach lee radford says they must focus on the rest of the season .
thousands of hull fc fans saw the team return to the city yesterday after victory at wembley on saturday .
later this week they face leeds rhinos in the super league and radford says he 's got a team capable of eventually winning the grand final at old trafford in october .
author: Matt Dean
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : a cloudy start to the day
text: it 's not looking like a great start this morning .
here 's my full weather forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

text: morning , jonathan here with all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter
